translation: wystarczająco, aż nadto [enough, or more than enough]
sentence: She's had ample time to get the work done.

translation: omen, znak [literary; a sign of what might happen in the future]
sentence: These sales figures are a good augury for another profitable year.

translation: łagodny, niegroźny [(of people) kind and gentle; not hurting anyone]
sentence: You would never have guessed his intentions from the benign expression on his face.

translation: rydwan [a two-wheeled vehicle that was used in ancient times for racing and fighting and was pulled by a horse or horses]
sentence: His enemies were men of the early iron age, and used the chariot in war.

translation: kępa [a group, especially of trees or flowers]
sentence: They hiked around a clump of cedar and then they were there.

translation: powszechny, pospolity [happening often or often seen or experienced and so not considered to be special]
sentence: Electric cars are increasingly commonplace.

translation: kucać [to bend your knees and lower yourself so that you are close to the ground and leaning forward slightly]
sentence: I crouched behind the chair to avoid being seen.

translation: celowe, zamierzone [done on purpose rather than by accident]
sentence: The speech was a deliberate attempt to embarrass the government.

translation: zbeszcześcić [to damage or show no respect towards something holy or very much respected]
sentence: It's a crime to desecrate the country's flag.

translation: hańba [embarrassment and the loss of other people's respect, or behavior that causes this]
sentence: He brought disgrace on the whole team by falsifying the results.

translation: dyspensa [formal; special permission, especially from the Church, to do something that is not usually allowed]
sentence: She needed a special dispensation to remarry.

translation: nijaki, bez wyrazu, bezpłciowy [looking the same in every part, usually in a way that most people consider to be boring]
sentence: The countryside is flat and featureless.

translation: jodła
sentence: The forests are chiefly composed of oak, fir, pine, ash and alder.

translation: zawrotny, dający zawroty głowy [feeling that everything is moving and that you are going to fall]
sentence: When I looked down from the top floor, I felt giddy.

translation: zdobywać, gromadzić (informacje) [to obtain information, knowledge, etc., sometimes with difficulty and often from various different places]
sentence: These figures were gleaned from a number of studies.

translation: napawać się [to feel or express great pleasure or satisfaction because of your own success or good luck, or someone else's failure or bad luck]
sentence: His enemies were quick to gloat at his humiliation.

translation: kleisty [sticky]
sentence: Short-grain rice turns into a soft, glutinous mass when cooked.

translation: żal, uraza [a feeling of anger or dislike toward someone because of something bad they have done to you in the past]
sentence: He is not the type of person to bear a grudge against anyone.

translation: szorstki [(of a person's voice) low and unfriendly, or (of a person's behavior) unfriendly or showing no patience]
sentence: "Yeah, so what?" came the gruff reply.

translation: wymizerowany, mizerny [looking very tired because of illness, worry, or a lack of sleep]
sentence: He'd been drinking the night before and was looking a bit haggard.

translation: nucić [to sing a tune with your lips closed]
sentence: She was humming softly to herself.

translation: niecny, niegodziwy [formal; not good or honest; that should make you feel shame]
sentence: The character of the first Medician pope shows a peculiar mixture of noble and ignoble qualities.

translation: zmuszać, nakłaniać [to make someone feel that they must do something]
sentence: I wonder what it is that impels him to exercise all the time.

translation: nieuchronny, nieunikniony [impossible to avoid]
sentence: Some assumption had to be made in these cases, however, and this one seemed ineluctable.

translation: moment, punkt [formal; a particular point in time]
sentence: At this juncture, it is impossible to say whether she will make a full recovery.

translation: upominek, pamiątka [a small object that someone gives you so that you will remember them]
sentence: My aunt gave me one of her brooches as a keepsake.

translation: ugniatać, wyrabiać [to press something, especially a mixture for making bread, firmly and repeatedly with the hands and fingers]
sentence: Knead the dough until smooth.

translation: bujny, zielony [(of plants, gardens, etc.) growing thickly and strongly in a way that is attractive; covered in healthy grass and plants]
sentence: The lake, with its lush scenery, is a favorite with canoeists.

translation: manat, krowa morska
sentence: The manatee's flippers, which bear nails, are also used to embrace and touch other manatees.

translation: miód pitny [a sweet alcoholic drink made from honey and water, drunk especially in the past]
sentence: In those times they were wise people, who realised how good mead was.

translation: wścibski [disapproving; (of people) enjoying getting involved in situations that do not concern them]
sentence: It is a meddlesome, bureaucratic and wrong-headed programme.

translation: niedola, cierpienie [great suffering of the mind or body]
sentence: Fame brought her nothing but misery.

translation: otwór [an opening or hole, especially one in the body, such as the mouth]
sentence: I was stuffing cake into every available orifice.

translation: uparty jak osioł [unwilling to change your opinion about something, in a way that other people think is annoying and unreasonable]
sentence: Why are you being so pigheaded about this?

translation: rabować, łupić [to steal, especially during a war]
sentence: Many of the region's churches had been plundered.

translation: niedostatek, ubóstwo [formal; a lack of the basic things that are necessary for an acceptable standard of living]
sentence: Economic privation is pushing the poor towards crime.

translation: opatrzność [literary; an influence that is not human in origin and is thought to control people's lives]
sentence: She believed her suffering was sent by providence.

translation: mops [a small dog with a flat face and a short, wide nose]
sentence: Pugs have many wrinkles in their faces, so owners will often clean inside the creases to avoid irritation and infection.

translation: wszczynać burdy, siać zniszczenie [(of people or animals) to move through a place in a group, usually breaking things and causing damage]
sentence: Several thousand demonstrators rampaged through the center of the city.

translation: wymagany, konieczny [formal; necessary or needed for a particular purpose]
sentence: He lacked the requisite skills for the job.

translation: wstążka [a long, narrow strip of material used to tie things together or as a decoration]
sentence: He tied up the present with ribbon.

translation: najistotniejszy [formal; most important or noticeable]
sentence: The article presented the salient facts of the dispute clearly and concisely.

translation: poparzyć [to burn the skin with boiling liquid or steam]
sentence: I dropped a pan of boiling water and scalded my leg.

translation: berło [a decorated rod carried by a king or queen at ceremonies as a symbol of their power]
sentence: They are the oldest surviving regalia in Britain and consist of a crown, a sword and a scepter.

translation: niewola, służebność [formal; the state of being under the control of someone else and of having no freedom]
sentence: In the past, the majority of women were consigned to a lifetime of servitude and poverty.

translation: zerwanie, odłączenie [formal; the act of ending a connection, relationship, etc. or of being separated from a person, place, etc.]
sentence: The minister announced the severance of aid to the country. The hardest thing to cope with was the severance from his family.

translation: łopata
sentence: The children took their pails and shovels to the beach.

translation: krzew [a large plant that is smaller than a tree and that has several stems of wood coming from the ground]
sentence: She planted some roses and other flowering shrubs.

translation: przemknąć [to walk towards or away from someone, trying not to be noticed]
sentence: She sidled past him, pretending that she had not seen him.

translation: osobliwość [formal; the quality of being strange]
sentence: He has been behaving with great singularity.

translation: odprysk, odłamek, drzazga [formal; a very small, thin piece of something, usually broken off something larger]
sentence: The glass smashed into slivers.

translation: mazgaić się, chlipać [to cry slightly in a way that is weak and does not make other people feel sympathy for you]
sentence: He's sitting in his bedroom snivelling because he was told off for not doing his homework.

translation: plwocina, ślina [liquid produced in the mouth to keep the mouth wet and to help to prepare food to be digested]
sentence: He wiped some spittle from his mouth.

translation: rozwalać się (na) [to spread the arms and legs out carelessly and untidily while sitting or lying down]
sentence: He was sprawling in an armchair in front of the TV.

translation: kiełkować [(of plants or seeds) to produce new leaves or buds; to start to grow]
sentence: The seeds will sprout in a few days.

translation: ponaglać, pospieszać (dosłownie: spinać ostrogami) [to encourage an activity or development or make it happen faster]
sentence: Rising consumer sales have the effect of spurring the economy to faster growth.

translation: kaftan bezpieczeństwa
sentence: Brody was locked in a padded cell and forced to wear a straitjacket.

translation: klasyfikować, rozwarstwiać [to arrange the different parts of something in separate layers or groups]
sentence: The sample of people questioned was drawn from the university's student register and stratified by age and gender.

translation: uprzejmy, gładki w obyciu [(especially of a man) confident, elegant, and polite, sometimes in a way that does not seem sincere]
sentence: The manager was suave and sophisticated.

translation: zamsz [leather that is slightly rough to touch and is not shiny]
sentence: She decided to wear her brown suede shoes.

translation: podatny, wrażliwy (na) [easily influenced or harmed by something]
sentence: She isn't very susceptible to flattery.

translation: grog [a drink made with strong alcohol, sugar, hot water, and sometimes spices]
sentence: After the swim in the icy water we all had a hot toddy to warm us up.

translation: puzon
sentence: The main orchestral brass instruments are the horn, trumpet, trombone, and tuba.

translation: nieokiełznany [not controlled and therefore extreme]
sentence: A dog should have an unbridled passion for food.

translation: przedwczesny [formal; happening too soon or sooner than is normal or expected]
sentence: She met a tragic and untimely death at 25.

translation: panorama, widok [literary; a view, especially a beautiful view from a high position]
sentence: After a hard climb, we were rewarded by a picture-postcard vista of rolling hills under a deep blue summer sky.

translation: nieużytek [an empty area of land, especially in or near a city, that is not used to grow crops or built on, or used in any way]
sentence: The car was dumped in a stretch of wasteland in the south of the city.

translation: utrudzony, zmęczony [very tired, especially after you have been working hard or doing something for a long time]
sentence: I think he's a little weary after his long journey.

translation: nabrzeże, estakada [an area like a wide wall built near the edge of the sea or a river where ships can be tied and goods can be taken off them]
sentence: The crates were unloaded onto the wharf.

translation: skręcać się, wić się [to make large twisting movements with the body]
sentence: The pain was so unbearable that he was writhing in agony.
